attributes.action: Keep parkrun free to encourage more people to stay fit and healthy!
attributes.additional_details:
On Saturday at 9am, about 80,000 people – more than twice the number who take part in the London Marathon – will gather in parks across the country to run, jog and walk five kilometres. Parents with buggies, children and grandparents, super-fit sprinters, dog walkers and people with disabilities, as well as volunteers, will come together at hundreds of courses across the UK.

Parkrun is a non-profit running movement. The ethos for the 850 runs is for the event to be free and open to everyone.
attributes.background:
Stoke Gifford Parish Council have taken unprecedented decision to start charging people to take part in Little Stoke parkrun- a free weekly 5kmand 2km run for kids. 

With UK obesity adult rates at over 60%, the government needs to protect parkrun from council fees to use their local parks.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This was a decision taken by Stoke Gifford Parish Council. Local councils are usually responsible for parks.
